canonical_structure.name: UBX-MON-HW
canonical_structure.description: Hardware status. Includes status of antenna, PIO pins, noise level, and AGC.

payload_fields.name: pinSel
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins set as peripheral/PIO

payload_fields.name: pinBank
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins set as bank A/B

payload_fields.name: pinDir
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins set as input/output

payload_fields.name: noisePerMS
payload_fields.description: Noise level as measured by the core

payload_fields.name: aStatus
payload_fields.description: Status of antenna supervisor state machine

payload_fields.name: usedMask
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins used by virtual pin manager

payload_fields.name: pinIrq
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins using PIO Irq

payload_fields.name: pullH
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins using pull high resistor

payload_fields.name: pullL
payload_fields.description: Mask of pins using pull low resistor

issues: Uses a versioned header (bytes 0-7) specific to ZED-F9H protocol versions
Incomplete extraction; payload truncated at byte 22 despite a 60-byte fixed length
Reserved block variant: pins details hidden/deprecated after byte 22
Highly truncated variant: pins details reserved after byte 19
Reserved block variant: pins details hidden/deprecated after byte 22

structure.offset_shift: Core fields (pinSel, etc) start at byte 8 instead of byte 0

valid_variations.reason: Specific high-precision GNSS modules (like ZED-F9H) use a versioned MON-HW message that includes GNSS support status in the first 8 bytes.
In newer firmware versions where UBX-MON-HW is deprecated in favor of UBX-MON-HW3 and UBX-MON-RF, the pin-specific details in the latter half of the payload are often marked as reserved or omitted.

adjudication.reasoning: The message UBX-MON-HW has a consistent length of 60 bytes across all platforms. The primary variation is between a 'Detailed' version (containing full PIO pin masks and virtual pin arrays) and a 'Reserved' version (where bytes 20/23 to 59 are opaque). The Detailed version is considered canonical as it is the historical standard for u-blox 8, M9, and early F9 firmware. Extraction 3 is a legitimate protocol variation for the ZED-F9H which adds a message version and GNSS capabilities to the header.
